snippet: United Nations aid officials are preparing a mission to study the plight of residents of Al Dhale caught in the crossfire between government troops and rebels.
abstract: United Nations aid officials, alarmed by reports of rising civilian casualties, prepare to visit Yemeni city Al Dhale for first time in months; they intend to assess the plight of residents caught in the crossfire between government troops and rebels fighting for the south's secession from the north.

byline.original: By NICK CUMMING-BRUCE and NASSER ARRABYEE
byline.contributor: Nick Cumming-Bruce reported from Geneva, and Nasser Arrabyee from Sana.

lead_paragraph: United Nations aid officials are preparing a mission to study the plight of residents of Al Dhale caught in the crossfire between government troops and rebels.

headline.main: U.N. to Assess Residents’ Risk in Southern Yemen City
headline.print_headline: U.N. to Assess Residents’ Risk in Southern Yemen City
